The reasons for calling the aggregates b: Form is deformed by cold, heat, hunger, thirst, and the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles.
Feeling feels pleasure, pain, and neutral.
Perception perceives blue, yellow, red, and white.
Choices produce conditioned phenomena, including form, feeling, perception, and consciousness.
Consciousness cognizes sour, bitter, pungent, sweet, hot, mild, salty, and bland.
Reflections of a noble disciple [sn22.79: In the past, I was also itched by form/feeling/perception/choices/consciousness just like now.
If I were to look forward to enjoying form/feeling/perception/choices/consciousness in the future, I’d be itched by form/feeling/perception/choices/consciousness in the future just as I am today.
The things a noble disciple gets rid of: They get rid of it and don’t accumulate it.
They give it up and don’t grasp it.
They discard it and don’t amass it.
They dissipate it and don’t get clouded by it.
The things a mendicant neither gets rid: They neither get rid of nor accumulate it, but remain after getting rid of it.
They neither give it up nor grasp it, but remain after giving it up.
They neither discard it nor amass it, but remain after discarding it.
They neither dissipate it nor get clouded by it, but remain after dissipating it.
